elements.title: tank cascade system (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sri Lanka's ancient tank cascade system of irrigation reservoirs creates habitats for the island's elephants (examples pictured)?

elements.title: Like as the hart (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Like as the hart", a setting of Psalm 42 for a cappella choir, was composed by Judith Weir, Master of the King's Music, for the state funeral of Elizabeth II?

elements.title: Rebeca Delgado (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rebeca Delgado created Freedom of Thought for Bolivia after being told by her previous party that she should leave if she wanted to be a "freethinker"?

elements.title: Amy Santiago (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Brooklyn Nine-Nine character Amy Santiago has straight hair because the show's two Latina regular cast members feared that one of them would be fired?

elements.title: Adam Kingsmill, (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Adam Kingsmill, who is missing most of his right leg, played stand-up ice hockey until 2016?

elements.title: drowned his four children (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 28-year-old tire store manager drowned his four children in the same station wagon in which his father fatally shot himself in the head?

elements.title: Malcolm Neesam (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that writer Malcolm Neesam was awarded the Freedom of the Borough of Harrogate, England, by the town council for services to local history?

elements.title: St. Mary's-in-Tuxedo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "perhaps the most notable wedding gown in existence" within the United States was once worn in St. Mary's-in-Tuxedo?
